definition: false/untrue to one's convictions/against one's will/disloyal
to disobey/to violate/to separate/to go against
false assertion/speech against one's own convictions

sentences.english: This is, of course, a counterintuitive argument.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个让所有人感到违心的论断。

sentences.english: You are endeavouring to disarm me by reason, and to convince me against my will.
sentences.chinese: 你是在设法说服我，让我违心地接受你的看法。

sentences.english: He said no father ever forces his daughter to marry against her will.
sentences.chinese: 他说没有任何一个父亲曾经强迫他的女儿违心地嫁人。

sentences.english: Don't allow yourself to be subject to peer pressure or encouraged to do something that you don't want to do.
sentences.chinese: 不要屈服于压力，也不要违心地做自己不想做的事。

sentences.english: Wish you happiness, I must say.
The seventh time when she sang a song of praise and deemed it a virtue.
sentences.chinese: 第七次，当它违心的大唱赞歌时，却将其看做美德。

sentences.english: According to my opinion, sub-building is probably fair view.
sentences.chinese: 据我的意见，子建大概是违心之论。

sentences.english: He bludgeoned me into doing something which I didn't want to do.
sentences.chinese: 他不断强迫我去做一些违心的事。

definition: to say sth without meaning it (idiom); to speak tongue in cheek/saying one thing but meaning sth different
heart and mouth at variance (idiom); keeping one's real intentions to oneself/saying one thing but meaning sth different
to bow down to everything sb says or does/to act submissively in order to ingratiate oneself
to fawn on/to flatter/to ingratiate oneself/flattery
friendly advice/words spoken on sb's behalf/a good word/kind words/words that sound fine but are not followed up with actions
to be glib in one's speech and wear an ingratiating expression (idiom)
